Recipe #1
---------
Gather all following ingredients and follow the directions to prepare this tasty meal.

Ingredients:
  red apple
  red onion
  yellow bell pepper

Directions:
  dice the red onion
  fry the red onion
  chop the yellow bell pepper
  fry the yellow bell pepper
  prepare meal
walkthrough: chop yellow bell pepper with knife

messages.content:
You are the player of a text-based cooking game.

These are the important game entities: 
cookbook:       Cookbook that contains the recipe.
<ingredient>:   Ingredient you can take, drop, cut, or cook according to the recipe.
<container>:    Container you can open, which can contain ingredients.
<door>:         Door you can open.
knife:          Knife to slice, dice, chop ingredients.
stove:          Stove to fry ingredients.
oven:           Oven to roast ingredients.
bbq:            BBQ to grill ingredients.
meal:           Meal you can eat.

These are the commands to interact with the game:
look
open <container>
close <container>
open <door>
close <door>
inventory
take <ingredient>
take knife
read cookbook
slice <ingredient> with knife
dice <ingredient> with knife
chop <ingredient> with knife
cook <ingredient> with stove    (fry an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with oven     (roast an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with bbq      (grill an ingredient)
prepare meal
eat meal

This is the basic game process:
Navigate to the kitchen and read the cookbook.
Take all ingredients according to the recipe.
Follow the recipe.
Eat the meal.

Your main task:
You provide answers to game engine queries following the command templates and game process above.
Never provide answers deviating from the command templates above - unless explicitly asked by the game engine.
Provide only one command at a time - unless the game engine explicitly asks to do something else.

Reason step-by-step about the feedback, the recipe, the items you are carrying and the room you are in and provide the next command. Use the format REASONING: <your reasoning here> NEXT COMMAND: <your next command here>

You are hungry! Let's cook a delicious meal. Check the cookbook in the kitchen for the recipe. Once done, enjoy your meal!

-= Kitchen =-
You arrive in a kitchen. An ordinary kind of place.

You make out an opened fridge. The fridge contains a raw pork chop. Wow, isn't TextWorld just the best? If you haven't noticed it already, there seems to be something there by the wall, it's an oven. You can make out a table. The table is massive. On the table you make out a knife. You can't wait to tell the folks at home about this! You see a counter. Make a note of this, you might have to put stuff on or in it later on. On the counter you can make out a cookbook. You see a stove. But the thing is empty, unfortunately. You move on, clearly done caring about TextWorld.

messages.content:
You are the player of a text-based cooking game.

These are the important game entities: 
cookbook:       Cookbook that contains the recipe.
<ingredient>:   Ingredient you can take, drop, cut, or cook according to the recipe.
<container>:    Container you can open, which can contain ingredients.
<door>:         Door you can open.
knife:          Knife to slice, dice, chop ingredients.
stove:          Stove to fry ingredients.
oven:           Oven to roast ingredients.
bbq:            BBQ to grill ingredients.
meal:           Meal you can eat.

These are the commands to interact with the game:
look
open <container>
close <container>
open <door>
close <door>
inventory
take <ingredient>
take knife
read cookbook
slice <ingredient> with knife
dice <ingredient> with knife
chop <ingredient> with knife
cook <ingredient> with stove    (fry an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with oven     (roast an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with bbq      (grill an ingredient)
prepare meal
eat meal

This is the basic game process:
Navigate to the kitchen and read the cookbook.
Take all ingredients according to the recipe.
Follow the recipe.
Eat the meal.

Your main task:
You provide answers to game engine queries following the command templates and game process above.
Never provide answers deviating from the command templates above - unless explicitly asked by the game engine.
Provide only one command at a time - unless the game engine explicitly asks to do something else.

Reason step-by-step about the feedback, the recipe, the items you are carrying and the room you are in and provide the next command. Use the format REASONING: <your reasoning here> NEXT COMMAND: <your next command here>

messages.content:
You are the player of a text-based cooking game.

These are the important game entities: 
cookbook:       Cookbook that contains the recipe.
<ingredient>:   Ingredient you can take, drop, cut, or cook according to the recipe.
<container>:    Container you can open, which can contain ingredients.
<door>:         Door you can open.
knife:          Knife to slice, dice, chop ingredients.
stove:          Stove to fry ingredients.
oven:           Oven to roast ingredients.
bbq:            BBQ to grill ingredients.
meal:           Meal you can eat.

These are the commands to interact with the game:
look
open <container>
close <container>
open <door>
close <door>
inventory
take <ingredient>
take knife
read cookbook
slice <ingredient> with knife
dice <ingredient> with knife
chop <ingredient> with knife
cook <ingredient> with stove    (fry an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with oven     (roast an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with bbq      (grill an ingredient)
prepare meal
eat meal

This is the basic game process:
Navigate to the kitchen and read the cookbook.
Take all ingredients according to the recipe.

messages.content:
You are the player of a text-based cooking game.

These are the important game entities: 
cookbook:       Cookbook that contains the recipe.
<ingredient>:   Ingredient you can take, drop, cut, or cook according to the recipe.
<container>:    Container you can open, which can contain ingredients.
<door>:         Door you can open.
knife:          Knife to slice, dice, chop ingredients.
stove:          Stove to fry ingredients.
oven:           Oven to roast ingredients.
bbq:            BBQ to grill ingredients.
meal:           Meal you can eat.

These are the commands to interact with the game:
look
open <container>
close <container>
open <door>
close <door>
inventory
take <ingredient>
take knife
read cookbook
slice <ingredient> with knife
dice <ingredient> with knife
chop <ingredient> with knife
cook <ingredient> with stove    (fry an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with oven     (roast an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with bbq      (grill an ingredient)
prepare meal
eat meal

This is the basic game process:
Navigate to the kitchen and read the cookbook.
Take all ingredients according to the recipe.
Follow the recipe.
Eat the meal.

Your main task:
You provide answers to game engine queries following the command templates and game process above.
Never provide answers deviating from the command templates above - unless explicitly asked by the game engine.
Provide only one command at a time - unless the game engine explicitly asks to do something else.

Reason step-by-step about the feedback, the recipe, the items you are carrying and the room you are in and provide the next command. Use the format REASONING: <your reasoning here> NEXT COMMAND: <your next command here>

messages.content:
You are the player of a text-based cooking game.

These are the important game entities: 
cookbook:       Cookbook that contains the recipe.
<ingredient>:   Ingredient you can take, drop, cut, or cook according to the recipe.
<container>:    Container you can open, which can contain ingredients.
<door>:         Door you can open.
knife:          Knife to slice, dice, chop ingredients.
stove:          Stove to fry ingredients.
oven:           Oven to roast ingredients.
bbq:            BBQ to grill ingredients.
meal:           Meal you can eat.

These are the commands to interact with the game:
look
open <container>
close <container>
open <door>
close <door>
inventory
take <ingredient>
take knife
read cookbook
slice <ingredient> with knife
dice <ingredient> with knife
chop <ingredient> with knife
cook <ingredient> with stove    (fry an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with oven     (roast an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with bbq      (grill an ingredient)
prepare meal
eat meal

This is the basic game process:
Navigate to the kitchen and read the cookbook.
Take all ingredients according to the recipe.
Follow the recipe.
Eat the meal.

Your main task:
You provide answers to game engine queries following the command templates and game process above.
Never provide answers deviating from the command templates above - unless explicitly asked by the game engine.
Provide only one command at a time - unless the game engine explicitly asks to do something else.

Reason step-by-step about the feedback, the recipe, the items you are carrying and the room you are in and provide the next command. Use the format REASONING: <your reasoning here> NEXT COMMAND: <your next command here>

You are the player of a text-based cooking game.

These are the important game entities: 
cookbook:       Cookbook that contains the recipe.
<ingredient>:   Ingredient you can take, drop, cut, or cook according to the recipe.
<container>:    Container you can open, which can contain ingredients.
<door>:         Door you can open.
knife:          Knife to slice, dice, chop ingredients.
stove:          Stove to fry ingredients.
oven:           Oven to roast ingredients.
bbq:            BBQ to grill ingredients.
meal:           Meal you can eat.

These are the commands to interact with the game:
look
open <container>
close <container>
open <door>
close <door>
inventory
take <ingredient>
take knife
read cookbook
slice <ingredient> with knife
dice <ingredient> with knife
chop <ingredient> with knife
cook <ingredient> with stove    (fry an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with oven     (roast an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with bbq      (grill an ingredient)
prepare meal
eat meal

This is the basic game process:
Navigate to the kitchen and read the cookbook.
Take all ingredients according to the recipe.
Follow the recipe.
Eat the meal.

messages.content:
You are the player of a text-based cooking game.

These are the important game entities: 
cookbook:       Cookbook that contains the recipe.
<ingredient>:   Ingredient you can take, drop, cut, or cook according to the recipe.
<container>:    Container you can open, which can contain ingredients.
<door>:         Door you can open.
knife:          Knife to slice, dice, chop ingredients.
stove:          Stove to fry ingredients.
oven:           Oven to roast ingredients.
bbq:            BBQ to grill ingredients.
meal:           Meal you can eat.

These are the commands to interact with the game:
look
open <container>
close <container>
open <door>
close <door>
inventory
take <ingredient>
take knife
read cookbook
slice <ingredient> with knife
dice <ingredient> with knife
chop <ingredient> with knife
cook <ingredient> with stove    (fry an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with oven     (roast an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with bbq      (grill an ingredient)
prepare meal
eat meal

This is the basic game process:
Navigate to the kitchen and read the cookbook.
Take all ingredients according to the recipe.
Follow the recipe.
Eat the meal.

Your main task:
You provide answers to game engine queries following the command templates and game process above.
Never provide answers deviating from the command templates above - unless explicitly asked by the game engine.
Provide only one command at a time - unless the game engine explicitly asks to do something else.

messages.content:
You are the player of a text-based cooking game.

These are the important game entities: 
cookbook:       Cookbook that contains the recipe.
<ingredient>:   Ingredient you can take, drop, cut, or cook according to the recipe.
<container>:    Container you can open, which can contain ingredients.
<door>:         Door you can open.
knife:          Knife to slice, dice, chop ingredients.
stove:          Stove to fry ingredients.
oven:           Oven to roast ingredients.
bbq:            BBQ to grill ingredients.
meal:           Meal you can eat.

These are the commands to interact with the game:
look
open <container>
close <container>
open <door>
close <door>
inventory
take <ingredient>
take knife
read cookbook
slice <ingredient> with knife
dice <ingredient> with knife
chop <ingredient> with knife
cook <ingredient> with stove    (fry an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with oven     (roast an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with bbq      (grill an ingredient)
prepare meal
eat meal

This is the basic game process:
Navigate to the kitchen and read the cookbook.
Take all ingredients according to the recipe.
Follow the recipe.
Eat the meal.

Your main task:
You provide answers to game engine queries following the command templates and game process above.
Never provide answers deviating from the command templates above - unless explicitly asked by the game engine.
Provide only one command at a time - unless the game engine explicitly asks to do something else.

Reason step-by-step about the feedback, the recipe, the items you are carrying and the room you are in and provide the next command. Use the format REASONING: <your reasoning here> NEXT COMMAND: <your next command here>

On the counter you can make out a red onion, a red hot pepper, a raw yellow potato and a cookbook. Look out! It's a- oh, never mind, it's just a stove. However, the stove, like an empty stove, has nothing on it. Hm. Oh well

messages.content:
You are the player of a text-based cooking game.

These are the important game entities: 
cookbook:       Cookbook that contains the recipe.
<ingredient>:   Ingredient you can take, drop, cut, or cook according to the recipe.
<container>:    Container you can open, which can contain ingredients.
<door>:         Door you can open.
knife:          Knife to slice, dice, chop ingredients.
stove:          Stove to fry ingredients.
oven:           Oven to roast ingredients.
bbq:            BBQ to grill ingredients.
meal:           Meal you can eat.

These are the commands to interact with the game:
look
open <container>
close <container>
open <door>
close <door>
inventory
take <ingredient>
take knife
read cookbook
slice <ingredient> with knife
dice <ingredient> with knife
chop <ingredient> with knife
cook <ingredient> with stove    (fry an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with oven     (roast an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with bbq      (grill an ingredient)
prepare meal
eat meal

This is the basic game process:
Navigate to the kitchen and read the cookbook.
Take all ingredients according to the recipe.
Follow the recipe.
Eat the meal.

Your main task:
You provide answers to game engine queries following the command templates and game process above.
Never provide answers deviating from the command templates above - unless explicitly asked by the game engine.
Provide only one command at a time - unless the game engine explicitly asks to do something else.

messages.content:
You are the player of a text-based cooking game.

These are the important game entities: 
cookbook:       Cookbook that contains the recipe.
<ingredient>:   Ingredient you can take, drop, cut, or cook according to the recipe.
<container>:    Container you can open, which can contain ingredients.
<door>:         Door you can open.
knife:          Knife to slice, dice, chop ingredients.
stove:          Stove to fry ingredients.
oven:           Oven to roast ingredients.
bbq:            BBQ to grill ingredients.
meal:           Meal you can eat.

These are the commands to interact with the game:
look
open <container>
close <container>
open <door>
close <door>
inventory
take <ingredient>
take knife
read cookbook
slice <ingredient> with knife
dice <ingredient> with knife
chop <ingredient> with knife
cook <ingredient> with stove    (fry an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with oven     (roast an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with bbq      (grill an ingredient)
prepare meal
eat meal

This is the basic game process:
Navigate to the kitchen and read the cookbook.
Take all ingredients according to the recipe.
Follow the recipe.
Eat the meal.

Your main task:
You provide answers to game engine queries following the command templates and game process above.
Never provide answers deviating from the command templates above - unless explicitly asked by the game engine.
Provide only one command at a time - unless the game engine explicitly asks to do something else.

Reason step-by-step about the feedback, the recipe, the items you are carrying and the room you are in and provide the next command. Use the format REASONING: <your reasoning here> NEXT COMMAND: <your next command here>

messages_raw.description:
-= Kitchen =-
Well how about that, you are in a place we're calling a kitchen.

You smell an interesting smell, and follow it to a fridge. The fridge contains an orange bell pepper, a raw pork chop and a cilantro. You can make out an oven. Wow, isn't TextWorld just the best? You make out a table. What a coincidence, weren't you just thinking about a table? The table is massive. But the thing is empty. You can see a counter. Wow, isn't TextWorld just the best? The counter is vast. On the counter you see a raw purple potato and a cookbook. Suddenly, you bump your head on the ceiling, but it's not such a bad bump that it's going to prevent you from looking at objects and even things. You bend down to tie your shoe. When you stand up, you notice a stove. However, the stove, like an empty stove, has nothing on it. Oh! Why couldn't there just be stuff on it?

messages_raw.content: REASONING: The next step is to prepare the meal.  NEXT COMMAND: prepare meal

messages_raw.feedback:
Adding the meal to your inventory.


Your score has just gone up by one point.

messages.content:
You are the player of a text-based cooking game.

These are the important game entities: 
cookbook:       Cookbook that contains the recipe.
<ingredient>:   Ingredient you can take, drop, cut, or cook according to the recipe.
<container>:    Container you can open, which can contain ingredients.
<door>:         Door you can open.
knife:          Knife to slice, dice, chop ingredients.
stove:          Stove to fry ingredients.
oven:           Oven to roast ingredients.
bbq:            BBQ to grill ingredients.
meal:           Meal you can eat.

These are the commands to interact with the game:
look
open <container>
close <container>
open <door>
close <door>
inventory
take <ingredient>
take knife
read cookbook
slice <ingredient> with knife
dice <ingredient> with knife
chop <ingredient> with knife
cook <ingredient> with stove    (fry an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with oven     (roast an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with bbq      (grill an ingredient)
prepare meal
eat meal

This is the basic game process:
Navigate to the kitchen and read the cookbook.
Take all ingredients according to the recipe.
Follow the recipe.
Eat the meal.

Your main task:
You provide answers to game engine queries following the command templates and game process above.
Never provide answers deviating from the command templates above - unless explicitly asked by the game engine.
Provide only one command at a time - unless the game engine explicitly asks to do something else.

Reason step-by-step about the feedback, the recipe, the items you are carrying and the room you are in and provide the next command. Use the format REASONING: <your reasoning here> NEXT COMMAND: <your next command here>

messages.content:
You are the player of a text-based cooking game.

These are the important game entities: 
cookbook:       Cookbook that contains the recipe.
<ingredient>:   Ingredient you can take, drop, cut, or cook according to the recipe.
<container>:    Container you can open, which can contain ingredients.
<door>:         Door you can open.
knife:          Knife to slice, dice, chop ingredients.
stove:          Stove to fry ingredients.
oven:           Oven to roast ingredients.
bbq:            BBQ to grill ingredients.
meal:           Meal you can eat.

These are the commands to interact with the game:
look
open <container>
close <container>
open <door>
close <door>
inventory
take <ingredient>
take knife
read cookbook
slice <ingredient> with knife
dice <ingredient> with knife
chop <ingredient> with knife
cook <ingredient> with stove    (fry an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with oven     (roast an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with bbq      (grill an ingredient)
prepare meal
eat meal

This is the basic game process:
Navigate to the kitchen and read the cookbook.
Take all ingredients according to the recipe.
Follow the recipe.
Eat the meal.

Your main task:
You provide answers to game engine queries following the command templates and game process above.
Never provide answers deviating from the command templates above - unless explicitly asked by the game engine.
Provide only one command at a time - unless the game engine explicitly asks to do something else.

Reason step-by-step about the feedback, the recipe, the items you are carrying and the room you are in and provide the next command. Use the format REASONING: <your reasoning here> NEXT COMMAND: <your next command here>

-= Kitchen =-
You're now in a kitchen. You decide to start listing off everything you see in the room, as if you were in a text adventure.

You can make out an opened fridge. The fridge contains some water, a yellow bell pepper, a parsley and a cilantro. Oh, great. Here's an oven. There's something strange about this being here, but you can't put your finger on it. You make out a table. There's something about an object in a room that's just so... TextWorld. The table is massive. On the table you make out a knife. I mean, just wow! Isn't TextWorld just the best? You scan the room, seeing a counter! The counter is vast. On the counter you make out a red hot pepper and a cookbook. Now that's what I call TextWorld! You can make out a stove. The stove is conventional. However, the stove, like an empty stove, has nothing on it. What, you think everything in TextWorld should have stuff on it?

cookbook:       Cookbook that contains the recipe.

stove:          Stove to fry ingredients.
oven:           Oven to roast ingredients.

meal:           Meal you can eat.

look

inventory

messages.content:
You are the player of a text-based cooking game.

These are the important game entities: 
cookbook:       Cookbook that contains the recipe.
<ingredient>:   Ingredient you can take, drop, cut, or cook according to the recipe.
<container>:    Container you can open, which can contain ingredients.
<door>:         Door you can open.
knife:          Knife to slice, dice, chop ingredients.
stove:          Stove to fry ingredients.
oven:           Oven to roast ingredients.
bbq:            BBQ to grill ingredients.
meal:           Meal you can eat.

These are the commands to interact with the game:
look
open <container>
close <container>
open <door>
close <door>
inventory
take <ingredient>
take knife
read cookbook
slice <ingredient> with knife
dice <ingredient> with knife
chop <ingredient> with knife
cook <ingredient> with stove    (fry an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with oven     (roast an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with bbq      (grill an ingredient)
prepare meal
eat meal

This is the basic game process:
Navigate to the kitchen and read the cookbook.
Take all ingredients according to the recipe.
Follow the recipe.
Eat the meal.

Your main task:
You provide answers to game engine queries following the command templates and game process above.
Never provide answers deviating from the command templates above - unless explicitly asked by the game engine.
Provide only one command at a time - unless the game engine explicitly asks to do something else.

Ah, the kitchen. This is some kind of kitchen, really great standard vibes in this place, a wonderful standard atmosphere. And now, well, you're in it.

You see an opened fridge. The fridge contains a carrot. You see an oven. You see a table. But the thing is empty, unfortunately. Look out! It's a- oh, never mind, it's just a counter. On the counter you make out a diced raw yellow potato, a yellow bell pepper, a raw red potato, a cookbook and a knife. You bend down to tie your shoe. When you stand up, you notice a stove. The stove is conventional. The stove appears to be empty. Aw, and here you were, all excited for there to be things on it!

messages_raw.content: REASONING:  I need the diced yellow potato from the counter to fry it. NEXT COMMAND: take diced raw yellow potato

messages_raw.feedback:
You take the yellow potato from the counter.


Your score has just gone up by one point.

Directions:

  fry the purple potato
  dice the yellow potato
  fry the yellow potato
  prepare meal
messages_raw.inventory:
You are carrying:
  a diced raw yellow potato
  a sliced fried purple potato

messages.content:
You are the player of a text-based cooking game.

These are the important game entities: 
cookbook:       Cookbook that contains the recipe.
<ingredient>:   Ingredient you can take, drop, cut, or cook according to the recipe.
<container>:    Container you can open, which can contain ingredients.
<door>:         Door you can open.
knife:          Knife to slice, dice, chop ingredients.
stove:          Stove to fry ingredients.
oven:           Oven to roast ingredients.
bbq:            BBQ to grill ingredients.
meal:           Meal you can eat.

These are the commands to interact with the game:
look
open <container>
close <container>
open <door>
close <door>
inventory
take <ingredient>
take knife
read cookbook
slice <ingredient> with knife
dice <ingredient> with knife
chop <ingredient> with knife
cook <ingredient> with stove    (fry an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with oven     (roast an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with bbq      (grill an ingredient)
prepare meal
eat meal

This is the basic game process:
Navigate to the kitchen and read the cookbook.
Take all ingredients according to the recipe.
Follow the recipe.
Eat the meal.

Your main task:
You provide answers to game engine queries following the command templates and game process above.
Never provide answers deviating from the command templates above - unless explicitly asked by the game engine.
Provide only one command at a time - unless the game engine explicitly asks to do something else.

Reason step-by-step about the feedback, the recipe, the items you are carrying and the room you are in and provide the next command. Use the format REASONING: <your reasoning here> NEXT COMMAND: <your next command here>

You are hungry! Let's cook a delicious meal. Check the cookbook in the kitchen for the recipe. Once done, enjoy your meal!

-= Kitchen =-
You arrive in a kitchen. You start to take note of what's in the room.

You see an open fridge. The fridge contains a raw pork chop. A closed conventional looking oven is nearby. You bend down to tie your shoe. When you stand up, you notice a table. Make a note of this, you might have to put stuff on or in it later on. On the table you see a cookbook. Hmmm... what else, what else? You can see a counter. Wow, isn't TextWorld just the best? The counter is vast. On the counter you can make out a diced raw purple potato, a raw yellow potato and a raw red potato. You can't wait to tell the folks at home about this! Look over there! a stove. The stove is conventional. But the thing is empty, unfortunately.

messages.content:
You are the player of a text-based cooking game.

These are the important game entities: 
cookbook:       Cookbook that contains the recipe.
<ingredient>:   Ingredient you can take, drop, cut, or cook according to the recipe.
<container>:    Container you can open, which can contain ingredients.
<door>:         Door you can open.
knife:          Knife to slice, dice, chop ingredients.
stove:          Stove to fry ingredients.
oven:           Oven to roast ingredients.
bbq:            BBQ to grill ingredients.
meal:           Meal you can eat.

These are the commands to interact with the game:
look
open <container>
close <container>
open <door>
close <door>
inventory
take <ingredient>
take knife
read cookbook
slice <ingredient> with knife
dice <ingredient> with knife
chop <ingredient> with knife
cook <ingredient> with stove    (fry an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with oven     (roast an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with bbq      (grill an ingredient)
prepare meal
eat meal

This is the basic game process:
Navigate to the kitchen and read the cookbook.
Take all ingredients according to the recipe.
Follow the recipe.
Eat the meal.

Your main task:
You provide answers to game engine queries following the command templates and game process above.
Never provide answers deviating from the command templates above - unless explicitly asked by the game engine.
Provide only one command at a time - unless the game engine explicitly asks to do something else.

Reason step-by-step about the feedback, the recipe, the items you are carrying and the room you are in and provide the next command. Use the format REASONING: <your reasoning here> NEXT COMMAND: <your next command here>

messages.content:
You are the player of a text-based cooking game.

These are the important game entities: 
cookbook:       Cookbook that contains the recipe.
<ingredient>:   Ingredient you can take, drop, cut, or cook according to the recipe.
<container>:    Container you can open, which can contain ingredients.
<door>:         Door you can open.
knife:          Knife to slice, dice, chop ingredients.
stove:          Stove to fry ingredients.
oven:           Oven to roast ingredients.
bbq:            BBQ to grill ingredients.
meal:           Meal you can eat.

These are the commands to interact with the game:
look
open <container>
close <container>
open <door>
close <door>
inventory
take <ingredient>
take knife
read cookbook
slice <ingredient> with knife
dice <ingredient> with knife
chop <ingredient> with knife
cook <ingredient> with stove    (fry an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with oven     (roast an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with bbq      (grill an ingredient)
prepare meal
eat meal

This is the basic game process:
Navigate to the kitchen and read the cookbook.
Take all ingredients according to the recipe.
Follow the recipe.
Eat the meal.

Your main task:
You provide answers to game engine queries following the command templates and game process above.
Never provide answers deviating from the command templates above - unless explicitly asked by the game engine.
Provide only one command at a time - unless the game engine explicitly asks to do something else.

Reason step-by-step about the feedback, the recipe, the items you are carrying and the room you are in and provide the next command. Use the format REASONING: <your reasoning here> NEXT COMMAND: <your next command here>

messages.content:
You are the player of a text-based cooking game.

These are the important game entities: 
cookbook:       Cookbook that contains the recipe.
<ingredient>:   Ingredient you can take, drop, cut, or cook according to the recipe.
<container>:    Container you can open, which can contain ingredients.
<door>:         Door you can open.
knife:          Knife to slice, dice, chop ingredients.
stove:          Stove to fry ingredients.
oven:           Oven to roast ingredients.
bbq:            BBQ to grill ingredients.
meal:           Meal you can eat.

These are the commands to interact with the game:
look
open <container>
close <container>
open <door>
close <door>
inventory
take <ingredient>
take knife
read cookbook
slice <ingredient> with knife
dice <ingredient> with knife
chop <ingredient> with knife
cook <ingredient> with stove    (fry an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with oven     (roast an ingredient)
cook <ingredient> with bbq      (grill an ingredient)
prepare meal
eat meal

This is the basic game process:
Navigate to the kitchen and read the cookbook.
Take all ingredients according to the recipe.
Follow the recipe.
Eat the meal.

Your main task:
You provide answers to game engine queries following the command templates and game process above.
Never provide answers deviating from the command templates above - unless explicitly asked by the game engine.
Provide only one command at a time - unless the game engine explicitly asks to do something else.

Reason step-by-step about the feedback, the recipe, the items you are carrying and the room you are in and provide the next command. Use the format REASONING: <your reasoning here> NEXT COMMAND: <your next command here>
